alert.note: Alert for Palm Beach (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 25 at 6:11PM EDT until September 25 at 8:15PM EDT by NWS Miami
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 815 PM EDT THIS EVENING FOR EASTERN PALM BEACH COUNTY... At 611 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated that the thunderstorms that been producing heavy rainfall has ended over the warning area which has produced between 3 and 6 inches of rainfall. There is still some light to moderate rains that are occurring over the warning area. There is also another line of showers and thunderstorms that is located over inland Broward County that is slowly moving to the north northeast towards the warning area. If this line moves into the warning area, then additional rainfall amounts 1 to 3 inches are possible over the warning area. Therefore, the Flash Flood Warning will remain in effect until 815 PM EDT this evening. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... West Palm Beach, Boca Raton, Boynton Beach, Delray Beach, Wellington, Palm Beach Gardens, Lake Worth, Riviera Beach, Palm Beach, Highland Beach, Ocean Ridge, Greenacres, Royal Palm Beach, Parkland, Palm Springs, North Palm Beach, Lantana, Lake Park, Atlantis and Haverhill. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
